Docs.typeparam: Specifies the type of the result.
Docs.summary: Provides a value type that can represent a synchronously available value or a task object.
Docs.remarks: s are meant to be directly awaited. To do more complicated operations with them, a should be extracted using or . Such operations might include caching an instance to be awaited later, registering multiple continuations with a single operation, awaiting the same task multiple times, and using combinators over multiple operations.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance valuetype System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask`1<!TResult> Preserve() cil managed
Public Function Preserve () As ValueTask(Of TResult)

Docs.summary: Gets a that may be used at any point in the future.
Docs.returns: A task object for future use.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Because a <xref:System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask%601> can be backed by a pooled <xref:System.Threading.Tasks.Sources.IValueTaskSource%601>, it is not safe to await an arbitrary <xref:System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask%601> multiple times. You can use the <xref:System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask%601.Preserve> method to convert this <xref:System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask%601> into the instance backed by a regular <xref:System.Threading.Tasks.Task%601> that is safe to await multiple times. This method is similar to <xref:System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask%601.AsTask>, but it returns the same <xref:System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask%601> instance when this <xref:System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask%601> represents a successful synchronously completed operation. After calling <xref:System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask%601.Preserve> the original <xref:System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask%601> should never be used again.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Result As TResult
public: property TResult Result { TResult get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the result.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property may only be accessed once, and only after this <xref:System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask%601> has completed.
If this <xref:System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask%601> has completed successfully, this property returns the resulting value. If this <xref:System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask%601> has faulted, this property raises an exception. The thrown exception is not wrapped in an <xref:System.AggregateException>.
